head.title: National Briefing | Rockies: Colorado: Special Session On Immigration

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | Rockies: Colorado: Special Session On Immigration

block.p: Gov. Bill Owens called the legislature into special session for next week to talk about immigration. Earlier this month, the State Supreme Court struck down a proposed ballot initiative that would have barred illegal immigrants from receiving non-emergency state and local services, and on Monday the court declined to reconsider. Mr. Owens, a Republican, said the Democratic-controlled legislature should either fashion a new referendum similar to the one invalidated by the court and send it on to the voters, or pass legislation that would address the same issues.

Gov. Bill Owens called the legislature into special session for next week to talk about immigration. Earlier this month, the State Supreme Court struck down a proposed ballot initiative that would have barred illegal immigrants from receiving non-emergency state and local services, and on Monday the court declined to reconsider. Mr. Owens, a Republican, said the Democratic-controlled legislature should either fashion a new referendum similar to the one invalidated by the court and send it on to the voters, or pass legislation that would address the same issues.
